Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets (with 24 balls remaining)
Alex Hales became a dream come true
Sam Curran dismissed Suryakumar Yadav for 44
Pre-Game Insights: England protected the short square boundary in Adelaide, giving away only two sixes until the start of the death overs
England saw a chance to break open a chase of 169 in the powerplay and seized it
England knew India's biggest threat with the ball in the powerplay is swing, so they moved around in the crease
England knew Surya's game is all about pace on the ball, so they took it off
England knew getting Kohli early was vital and so they went to their big game player at this World Cup
England knew the square boundaries are dangerous here at the Adelaide Oval, so they kept it tight on the stumps, taking the pace off, or went yorkers
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
England won by 10 wickets (with 24 balls remaining)
England's second-highest score against India in a T20I while the field restrictions were on
